cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 205 miles ESE of Wilmington North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest and slowing, then turning WNW to west, aiming directly toward the southern North Carolina coast near Wilmington and later drifting slowly across eastern South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just north of Wilmington, NC (around Cape Fear/Surf City)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: Not expected to move back offshore near Wilmington within the 5-day period

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC (Hurricane Watch); Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC and north of Duck NC to NC/VA border (Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Duck NC including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds (Hurricane & Storm Surge Warnings); north of Duck NC to Cape Charles Light VA (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeastern North Carolina and northeastern South Carolina coastline, including Cape Fear to Cape Lookout
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) likely by this afternoon; hurricane-force winds (≥74 mph) possible late tonight into Friday with a 53% chance of 64-kt winds at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge of 6–9 ft possible from North Myrtle Beach SC to Cape Fear and 9–13 ft between Cape Fear and Cape Lookout which includes Wilmington’s coastal area.
weather_observation.rainfall: 20–30 inches of rain with isolated totals to 40 inches forecast along coastal North Carolina, producing catastrophic flash flooding and prolonged river flooding around Wilmington.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large destructive waves, dangerous rip currents, and a few tornadoes in outer bands.
